body.p:
The Batch Converter script helps you to convert between the following formats:
HTML to XHTML
HTML to DITA
HTML to DocBook4 / DocBook5
Markdown to XHTML
Markdown to DITA
Markdown to DocBook4 / DocBook5
Word to XHTML
Word to DITA
Word to DocBook4 / DocBook5
Excel to DITA
JSON to XML
JSON to YAML
XML to JSON
YAML to JSON

This script requires the Oxygen Batch Documents Converter add-on to be installed in the all platforms distribution of . To install the add-on, follow these instructions:
Go on the Oxygen Batch Documents Converter plugin Releases page and download the latest oxygen-batch-converter-{version}-plugin.jar package.
Unzip it inside {oxygenInstallDir}/plugins.Do not create any intermediate folders. Afterwards, the file system should look like this: {oxygenInstallDir}/plugins/oxygen-batch-converter-{version}/plugin.xml

section.title: Arguments for the Batch Converter Script

p.codeblock: sh scripts/batchConverter.sh -i inputFiles -if inputFormat -o outputDirectory -of outputFormat [-ss (true|false)] [-csd (true|false)]

dlentry.dd: A list of space-separated input files or directories in file syntax form.
The format of the input files. The possible values are: html, markdown, word, excel, json, yaml or xml.
The output directory in file syntax form.
The format of the output files. The possible values are: xhtml, dita, docbook4, docbook5, json, yaml or xml.

dlentry.dt: -ss (true|false) [only for Word to DITA, HTML to DITA, and Markdown to DITA conversions]
dlentry.dd: Splits sections marked by titles or headings to separate files and create a DITA map. The possible values are true or false (default).
Creates short description elements from the first paragraph before the headings. Possible values are true or false (default).
